intro: Hieracium pseudoalbidum, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Hieracium pseudoalbidum is often found in open habitats and is relatively common in its native range.
